result.execSummary:
The defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA and Victim/Witness surcharges. Court will allow defendant one year to pay (8-7-15); failure to pay will result in entry of civil judgment.

Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. Provide DNA sample and pay costs.
Concurrent with:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont for Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has pending revocation.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 100 days time served.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including, DNA  and Victim/Witness surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample and pay costs.
Court will allow defendant one year to pay (8-7-2015); failure to pay will result in entry of civil judgment.
Defendant remanded.
Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has pending revocation on 7-24-2014. Case is adjourned to 8-7-2014 at 8:15 for plea/sentencing.

Atty Valeria Taylor is requesting a brief adjournment to obtain an offer from the State to resolve on next date.  ADA Liegel is in another court this morning.
Defendant is in custody.
Case is adjourned to 7-14-2014 at 8:15.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes not in court, in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has VOP hold. Case adjourned to 7-10-2014 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA/sentencing. ls

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Dugan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Dewayne Clifton Stokes in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
